title: I have an old Apple Magic Mouse which takes batteries, but the battery compartment is filled with dry, white, powdery stuff that is also sticking to the sides of the batteries and compartment. What is it and how do I clean it? - Quora
tags: Advice About Apple Products and Services

response.answer_text: The white powder is corrosion from old batteries, you can clean it up with an electronic cleaner, rags and you may need some very fine sandpaper (1000g) to clean the metal contacts. Be careful to use gloves and eye protection and not breathe in the dust. Then change the batteries
It is dried battery acid, which means the contact and maybe the wires have corrosion on them. Your best bet is to throw out the mouse, and buy a new one.
